from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
import re
import time

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError


[docs]class HwcTest(TestBase):

[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(HwcTest, self).__init__()
        self.ignore_list = self.test_control.get('ignore_list', None)
        self.hwc_options = self.test_control.get('hwc_options', None)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("Running hwc test")

        self.localhost = self.host.localhost
        self.hostname = self.host.hostname

        # List of commands that are tested:
        # power_off
        # power_on
        # power_status
        # power_reset
        # log
        # log_clear
        # bmc_time
        # bmc_version
        # bic_version
        # sensors
        # power_reset_sled
        # power_soft
        # reset_cmos
        # reset_oob
        # full_ac_reset
        # ping
        # led_off_on
        # reset_cmos_noreboot

        # @@@ TODO: Skipping this for now as we don't have a good way to automate:
        # set_bios_boot

        # By default, this test runs ping, power_off_on, power_reset
        # It also checks for power_status
        self.test_ping()
        self.test_power_off_on()
        self.test_power_reset()

        hwc_type = {
            'bmc_time': self.get_bmc_time,
            'bmc_version': self.get_bmc_version,
            'bic_version': self.get_bic_version,
            'sensors': self.get_sensors,
            'power_soft': self.test_power_soft,
            'full_ac_reset': self.test_full_ac_reset,
            'power_reset_sled': self.test_power_reset_sled,
            'reset_cmos': self.test_reset_cmos,
            'reset_oob': self.test_reset_oob,
            'get_log': self.test_log,
            'dimms': self.test_bad_dimms,
            'led_off_on': self.test_led_off_on,
            'reset_cmos_noreboot': self.test_reset_cmos_noreboot
        }

        # Runs for other options, provided in the hwc_options list
        if self.hwc_options:
            for options in self.hwc_options:
                hwc_type[options]()


    error_list = ["Error", "error", "err_code", "timed out"]


[docs]    def get_bmc_time(self):
        try:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("get_time")
            self.validate_condition(True, "Bmc time - %s" % (out))
        except Exception as e:
            self.validate_output(str(e))



[docs]    def get_bmc_version(self):
        try:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("get_version")
            self.validate_condition(True, "Bmc Version - %s" % (out))
        except Exception as e:
            self.validate_output(str(e))



[docs]    def get_bic_version(self):
        try:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("get_bic_version")
            self.validate_condition(True, "Bic Version - %s" % (out))
        except Exception as e:
            self.validate_output(str(e))



[docs]    def power_status(self, expected=None, timeout=None):
        if timeout:
            end_time = time.time() + timeout

        while True:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("power_status")
            if expected in out:
                break
            elif timeout and time.time() < end_time:
                continue
            else:
                break

        self.validate_in(
            expected, out,
            "Validate that system is currently powered %s" % (expected)
        )



[docs]    def test_power_off_on(self):
        self.power_status(expected="ON")
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        self._run_hwc_command("power_off")
        self.power_status(expected="OFF", timeout=180)

        self.validate_exception(
            self.host.run, ["uptime"], "Validate that system is down"
        )

        self._run_hwc_command("power_on")
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        self.power_status(expected="ON")



[docs]    def test_power_reset(self):
        self.power_status(expected="ON")
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        self._run_hwc_command("power_reset")
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        self.power_status(expected="ON")



[docs]    def test_log(self):
        out = self._run_hwc_command("log")
        # @@@ TODO: We could inject some messages into the log and verify that
        # they show up here, but I'm not sure about the best way to do this

        out = self._run_hwc_command("log_clear")
        self.validate_in(
            "Hardware log cleared", out,
            "Check that the hardware log was cleared"
        )
        self._run_hwc_command("log")


        # @@@ TODO: Noticed that on some systems (Leopard) there's always the
        # following entry in the log, even after running log_clear:
        # OEM SEL Status |  | Asserted
        # self.validate_condition(
        #    "No event logs found" in out,
        #    "Log is cleared: %s" % (out)
        #)


[docs]    def test_full_ac_reset(self):
        self.power_status(expected="ON")
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        self._run_hwc_command("full_ac_reset")
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        self.power_status(expected="ON")



[docs]    def test_power_reset_sled(self):
        result = False
        self.power_status(expected="ON")
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        try:
            self._run_hwc_command("power_reset_sled")
        except Exception as e:
            result = self.validate_output(str(e))
        if not result:
            self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
            self.power_status(expected="ON")



[docs]    def test_reset_cmos(self):
        result = False
        self.power_status(expected="ON")
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        try:
            self._run_hwc_command("reset_cmos")
        except Exception as e:
            result = self.validate_output(str(e))
        if not result:
            self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
            self.power_status(expected="ON")



[docs]    def test_reset_oob(self):
        result = False
        current_reboot = self.host.oob.bmc_host.get_last_reboot()
        try:
            self._run_hwc_command("reset_oob")
        except Exception as e:
            result = self.validate_output(str(e))
        if not result:
            self.host.oob.bmc.check_usb0 = False
            self.host.oob.bmc.bmc_health_check(current_reboot)



[docs]    def get_sensors(self):
        try:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("sensors")
            self.validate_condition(True, "Sensors output - %s" % (out))
        except Exception as e:
            self.validate_output(str(e))



[docs]    def test_power_soft(self):
        self.power_status(expected="ON")
        current_reboot = self.host.get_last_reboot()
        self._run_hwc_command("power_soft")
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        self.power_status(expected="ON")



[docs]    def test_bad_dimms(self):
        out = self._run_hwc_command("log_clear")
        self.host.inject_dimms_error()
        out = self._run_hwc_command("dimms")
        match = re.search(r"\:\sDIMM_\w+,\sDIMM_\w+,\sDIMM_\w+,\sDIMM_\w+", out)
        if match:
            self.validate_condition(True, "Bad Dimms - %s" % (out))
        else:
            raise TestError("HWC failed to capture error")
        out = self._run_hwc_command("log_clear")



[docs]    def test_ping(self):
        out = self._run_hwc_command("ping")
        self.validate_condition(True, "Ping - %s" % (out))



[docs]    def test_led_off_on(self):
        try:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("led_off")
            self.validate_condition(True, "LED OFF - %s" % (out))
        except Exception as e:
            self.validate_output(str(e))
        self.test_led_on()



[docs]    def test_led_on(self):
        try:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("led_on")
            self.validate_condition(True, "LED ON - %s" % (out))
        except Exception as e:
            self.validate_output(str(e))



[docs]    def test_reset_cmos_noreboot(self):
        try:
            out = self._run_hwc_command("reset_cmos_noreboot")
            self.validate_condition(True, "Reset CMOS noreboot - %s" % (out))
        except Exception as e:
            self.validate_output(str(e))



[docs]    def validate_output(self, out):
        if any(field in out for field in self.error_list):
            self.validate_condition(False, "Failed to execute the command")
        else:
            result = str(out.split(": ")[1]).strip('\n')
            self.validate_in(
                result, self.ignore_list, "Check for known messages"
            )
            return result


    def _run_hwc_command(self, cmd):
        base_cmd = "hwc"
        cmd = base_cmd + " " + cmd + " " + self.hostname
        self.log_info("Running %s" % (cmd))

        # @@@ TODO: Currently hwc requires an actual user account, it doesn't
        # accept service users.
        user = "export FB_UNIXNAME=janseidel"

        out = self.localhost.run(user + " && " + cmd)
        return out


[docs]    def cleanup(self):
        super(HwcTest, self).cleanup(cfg_filter=['log_util'])



[docs]def main():
    test = HwcTest()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
